title: Evidence-Based Decision-Making Competency Enhancement in Mathematics Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations and data interpretation competencies
context.additional_context: Learners acquire evidence-based methods to solve mathematical problems encountered in daily life (e.g., budget management, statistical interpretation), with practical exercises using digital devices (tablets, etc.).

learning_goals: Learners can construct specific and measurable questions using the PICO (Problem-Intervention-Comparison-Outcome) framework in given problem situations.
Learners can systematically collect and analyze relevant evidence from diverse sources (public data, research reports, etc.) and apply it to decision-making.
Based on evidence evaluation and critical thinking, learners can derive optimal solutions and express them through mathematical modeling.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
